中文简介: 作为中国的邻国、东方唯一的西方国家、世界第三大经济体，日本的发展经验对中国有独特和重要的价值。20世纪90年代中期以前，中国关注二战后日本实现经济高速增长的原因，挖掘值得借鉴的经验，90年代中期以后，中国关注日本泡沫经济破灭的教训，旨在趋利避害。进入21世纪，世界政治经济秩序深度调整，日本的宏观经济形势、货币政策、产业转型升级、长期通缩、对外经济战略、参与区域经济一体化等均受到中国的关注。本课程基于授课人对日本经济社会的观察和与众多决策者的深入接触，回顾当前日本经济状况的历史和政策源头、外界对日本的误解和误判、日本处理与美国关系的方式，以及深入解读企业文化等，从跨学科的政治、外交、社会、区域化和全球化、国际比较等广泛视角研究日本经济问题，希望通过本课开阔并加深学生对日本经济的认识与理解，同时也是对日本经济学科研究方法的拓展。
英文简介: As our neighbor, the only western country in the East and the third largest economy in the world, Japan’s development experience is of unique and significant value to China.Before 90’s last century, China focused on the root cause of Japan’s high speed growth, exploiting experience worth of learning. After mid-90’s, China focused on the lesson of Japan’s bubble economy bursting, aiming at making rational decisions in our own development. Entering 21st century, world political and economic order undergoes profound readjustment. Japan’s macro-economy, monetary policy, industrial transformation and upgrading, prolonged deflation, international economic strategy, and participation of regional integration have attracted China’s attention.This class is based on lecturer’s long time observation of Japan’s economy and society in person, as well as close contact with many policymakers, tracing the history and policy source of current economic status of Japan, interpreting the misreading and misjudging from outside world, observing how Japan deals relationship with the United States, and understanding enterprise culture of Japan. Students are expected to widen and deepen understanding of Japan’s economy from interdisciplinary perspectives including political, diplomatic, social, regional and global, international comparison. This class is also an expansion of discipline research method of Japan economy.

英文名称: Introduction to new structural economics (Part I)
中文简介: 本课程主要系统介绍新结构经济学的纲领、原理与方法，主要内容包括新结构经济学的结构范式革命、理论体系及其实践应用。新结构经济学总纲部分讲授新结构经济学对新古典经济学的结构革命；新结构经济学导论部分讲授的具体内容包括：中国与世界的经济简史及其经济结构安排多样性与经济系统复杂性概览，经济思想简史与新结构经济学的来龙去脉，新结构经济学基本原理与新结构经济学各子领域。新结构经济学基本原理的内容包括：禀赋结构供给原理、禀赋结构需求原理、禀赋结构相对价格原理、最优生产结构原理（比较优势原理）、生产结构的供求原理、结构变迁循环累积因果原理、自生能力原理、最优转型（改革）原理、政府因势利导原理、政府最优干预原理等十大原理。新结构经济学各领域的内容包括：新结构产业经济学、新结构金融学、新结构劳动经济学、新结构空间经济学、新结构国际经济学、新结构经济周期理论、新结构环境经济学、新结构制度经济学等八大领域。实践部分主要讲授的内容包括：新结构经济学应用研究方法论和政策分析工具，及其在国别发展、地区发展与企业发展等层面的应用。
英文简介: This course offers a systematic presentation of the principles, theories and methods of new structural economics. It will mainly cover the structural paradigm shift brought about by new structural economics, as well as its theoretical systems and its practical applications. This course will teach, in part, about this paradigm shift to neoclassical economics; the specific content of this introduction to new structural economics will include (1) a brief overview of the economic histories of China and the world, as well as the diversity of their economic structures, and the complexity of economic systems, (2) a brief history of economic theories and the origins and development of new structural economics, and (3) the basic principles of new structural economics and the discipline’s sub-fields. The ten basic principles of new structural economics are the endowment structure supply principle, the endowment structure demand principle, the endowment structure relative price principle, the optimal production structure principle (the law of comparative advantage), the supply and demand principle of production structure, the circular cumulative causation principle of structural change, the autonomy principle, the optimal change (or revolution) principle, the optimal governance principle and the principle of optimal government intervention. The eight subfields of new structural economics are new structural industrial economics, new structural finance, new structural labor economics, new structural spatial economics, new structural international economics, the new structural theory of economic cycles, new structural environmental economics and new structural institutional economics. The application section of the course will primarily cover the applied research methodology and policy analysis tools of new structural economics, as well as their applications to national, regional and enterprise development.

中文简介: 本课程将以“制度变革驱动的经济发展”为主线，展开对中国经济有关专题的介绍和分析，特别集中于改革开放以来中国经济取得的成就和面临的挑战。本课程要求选修的同学对中国经济有一个轮廓性的认识，并在此基础之上对中国经济的某些侧面有更深入的了解和理解。任课老师希望把自己关于中国经济现象的一得之见，提供给同学参考、讨论和批评，也希望同学们提出自己的观察与看法，共同提升对中国经济问题的兴趣和分析能力。
英文简介: "Special Topics on Chinese Economy" is a course aimed at building up capability of analyzing economic reality -- especially the reality of Chinese economy -- through economic theories. Classical macroeconomic and financial models will be introduced in the course, to help students to see through the real world problems, and to understand the economic insight behind the reality.This is an application-oriented course. The ultimate goal of this course is to help students to get into the current debate about the Chinese economy, to get familiar with different arguments about heated topics such as rebalancing of the economic structure, growth of the shadow banking system, financial liberalization, etc.This is also a course that emphasizes on economic theory. Classical economic models such as Neoclassical growth model, Monetary economic model, New Keynesian model, financial accelerator model, etc. will be introduced in an accessible way to undergraduate students. Intuitions of these economic models and their applications in the real world will be revealed in the course.This is a course on the Chinese economy. Economic analyzing tools lectured in the course are selected on the basis of whether they deepen our understanding of China. The difference between the Chinese economy and mature market-based economies will be explained in the course. Students are expected to build up a general framework, in which different aspects of the Chinese economy can be analyzed in a consistent way.
